docs.text: apocalypse now , based on the novel " hearts of darkness " , is an extremely striking , gripping , and horrifying depiction of the vietnam war from another angle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a long debate has surrounded this movie as if it is actually an anti-war film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in many ways , this debate could go either way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: apocalypse now is probably one of the most memorable vietnam war films ever made .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in addition , now film has gone to the extremes that this film does - a disturbing look at the corruption and terrifying effects of the most devastating war of recent years .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: apocalypse now follows the mission captain benjamin l . willard , played by martin sheen , to seek out and eliminate colonel walter e . kurtz , a green beret who is thought to have gone insane and set up his own militant base in cambodia .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: captain willard is ordered to assassinate kurtz with " extreme prejudice " because he has been deemed a murderer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: willard accepts his mission , but not while pondering the accusation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: accusing someone of murder in this situation is like " handing out speeding tickets at the indy 500 " , as he puts it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it doesn't make too much sense .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: escorting him on his mission are a group of men who operate a riverboat .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the men are chef ( frederic forrest ) , chief ( albert hall ) , lance johnson ( sam bottoms ) and mr . clean ( a fifteen year-old laurence fishburne ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: willard is ordered not to let them know exactly what his mission is , but they all know it is something big .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the men encounter many exciting , dangerous and bizarre situations .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but no situation is more bizarre than the infamous napalm scene with a very eccentric robert duvall as lieutenant colonel kilgore .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kilgore decides to attack and overtake a certain beach area so that his men can surf .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: surf .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is all inspired when kilgore is able to meet the famed california surfer lance johnson .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: duvall's portrayal as lieutenant colonel kilgore is terrific , and , he provides a number of memorable quotes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: eventually , captain willard encounters colonel kurtz's frightening community full of strange things everywhere you look , especially his followers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of his main followers is a freelance photographer ( dennis hopper ) who attempts to convey the situations to willard .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but willard cannot understand the madness that encompasses the colony .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kurtz is actually well aware of willard's mission , and refers to him as " an errand boy sent by grocery clerks to collect a bill " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yet willard is intent on completing his mission , no matter what shocking things kurtz does .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: apocalypse now , possibly one of the greatest films ever made , is a stunning vision into the madness that corresponds to the vietnam war .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a movie that will hypnotize you with it's brilliant cinematography , apocalypse now is an outstanding epic drama about the controversial and horrifying ravages of war .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: definitely on the " do not miss " list .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: be prepared for a very memorable film .
docs.label: positive
